<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="644" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="515" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Southern Company Services, Inc.</font></p> </td>
        <td width="129" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Original Sheet No. 4</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Second Revised Rate Schedule FERC Number 138</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:12pt;text-align:center;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:12pt;text-align:center;'><u><b><font SIZE=2>ARTICLE III - PRINCIPAL OBJECTIVES OF</font></b></u></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:6pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><u><b><font SIZE=2>INTERCOMPANY INTERCHANGE CONTRACT</font></b></u></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 3.1</font></u><font size=2>:  The purpose of this IIC is to provide the contractual basis for the continued operation of the electric facilities of the OPERATING COMPANIES in such a manner as to achieve the maximum possible economies consistent with the highest practicable reliability of service, with the reasonable utilization of natural resources and effect on the environment, and to provide a basis for equitably sharing among the OPERATING COMPANIES the costs associated with the operation of facilities that are used for the mutual benefit of all the OPERATING COMPANIES. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 3.2</font></u><font size=2>:  It is recognized that reliability of service and economy of operation require that the energy supply to the system be controlled by means of centralized economic dispatch and that this will require adequate communication facilities and the provision of economic dispatch computer facilities and automatic controls of generation. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 3.3</font></u><font size=2>:  It is recognized that the IIC provides for the retention of lowest cost energy resources by each OPERATING COMPANY for its own customers.  Energy in excess of that necessary to meet each OPERATING COMPANY&#146;s requirements is delivered to the Pool as Interchange Energy and may include: (i) energy generated from plants other than conventional hydro or nuclear; and (ii) purchased energy. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 3.4</font></u><font size=2>:  It is recognized that, under this IIC, each OPERATING COMPANY will share in the benefits and pay its share of the costs of coordinated operations as agreed upon in accordance with </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="643" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="501" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Issued by:  Charles D. Long, IV, V.P., Fleet Operations &amp; Trading</font></p> </td>
        <td width="141" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Effective: May 1, 2007</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Issued on:  May 18, 2007</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Filed pursuant to order dated April 19, 2007 accepting compliance filing in Docket Nos. EL05-102, </font><u><font size=2>et</font></u><font size=2> </font><u><font size=2>al</font></u><font size=2>., </font><u><font size=2>Southern Company Services, Inc.</font></u><font size=2>, 119 FERC &#182; 61,065 (2007).</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="644" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="515" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Southern Company Services, Inc.</font></p> </td>
        <td width="129" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Original Sheet No. 5</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Second Revised Rate Schedule FERC Number 138</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><font size=2>the terms hereof.  All costs and revenues associated with wholesale transactions under this IIC will be shared among all OPERATING COMPANIES on a comparable basis through the application of the governing procedures and methodologies to all such OPERATING COMPANIES. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 3.5</font></u><font size=2>:  It is recognized by the OPERATING COMPANIES that coordinated electric operation contemplates minimum cost of power supply upon the interconnected system, consistent with service requirements and other operating limitations.  Benefits of integrated operation accruing to the respective OPERATING COMPANIES are predicated upon cooperative efforts toward this objective and are so reflected in all IIC determinations. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 3.6</font></u><font size=2>:  This IIC is applicable only to the transactions described herein, as specifically set forth in ARTICLE VII &#150; INTERCHANGE CAPACITY TRANSACTIONS BETWEEN THE OPERATING COMPANIES, ARTICLE VIII &#150; INTERCHANGE ENERGY TRANSACTIONS BETWEEN THE OPERATING COMPANIES, and ARTICLE IX &#150; PROVISION FOR OTHER INTERCHANGE TRANSACTIONS.  Otherwise, sales between the OPERATING COMPANIES (including, but not limited to, sales from Southern Power Company to the other OPERATING COMPANIES or sales from the other OPERATING COMPANIES to Southern Power Company) require an appropriate filing under Section 205 of the Federal Power Act and acceptance thereof by the Commission.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:12pt;text-align:center;'><u><b><font SIZE=2>ARTICLE IV - ESTABLISHMENT OF OPERATING COMMITTEE</font></b></u></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:6pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><u><b><font SIZE=2>AND DESIGNATION OF AGENT </font></b></u><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 4.1 &#150; Establishment of Operating Committee</font></u><font size=2>:  A designated representative from each of the </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="643" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="501" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Issued by:  Charles D. Long, IV, V.P., Fleet Operations &amp; Trading</font></p> </td>
        <td width="141" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Effective: May 1, 2007</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Issued on:  May 18, 2007</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Filed pursuant to order dated April 19, 2007 accepting compliance filing in Docket Nos. EL05-102, </font><u><font size=2>et</font></u><font size=2> </font><u><font size=2>al</font></u><font size=2>., </font><u><font size=2>Southern Company Services, Inc.</font></u><font size=2>, 119 FERC &#182; 61,065 (2007).</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>



<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="644" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="515" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Southern Company Services, Inc.</font></p> </td>
        <td width="129" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Original Sheet No. 6</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Second Revised Rate Schedule FERC Number 138</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><font size=2>OPERATING COMPANIES, together with a designated representative of the AGENT who shall act as chairman, shall form and constitute an Operating Committee to meet as needed to determine the methods of operation hereunder. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 4.2 &#150; Duties of Operating Committee</font></u><font size=2>:  The Operating Committee&#146;s areas of responsibility include such matters as developing the concepts, terms and conditions of this IIC; providing guidance and direction to the AGENT regarding economic power system operations and the costs associated therewith; reviewing and recommending generation expansion plans for approval by the respective OPERATING COMPANIES pursuant to Section 4.3; and addressing other power system matters that relate to the overall coordinated operation of the Southern electric system.  Each OPERATING COMPANY representative has one vote and all decisions must be unanimous. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 4.3 &#150; Review and Recommendation of Generation Expansion Plans</font></u><font size=2>:  The Southern Power Company representative on the Operating Committee will not participate in reviewing and recommending generation expansion plans of the other OPERATING COMPANIES or the system, nor will the Southern Power Company representative have access to materials developed in conjunction with the formulation of such generation expansion plans.  Notwithstanding Section 4.2 above, the Southern Power Company representative shall not be eligible to vote with respect to these expansion plans.  Moreover, Southern Power Company will not receive market information from the other OPERATING COMPANIES through its participation in the Operating Committee. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 4.4 &#150; Transmission Information</font></u><font size=2>:  The Operating Committee does not have any duties or responsibilities with respect to transmission-related activities (including transmission reliability) and, </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="643" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="501" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Issued by:  Charles D. Long, IV, V.P., Fleet Operations &amp; Trading</font></p> </td>
        <td width="141" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Effective: May 1, 2007</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Issued on:  May 18, 2007</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Filed pursuant to order dated April 19, 2007 accepting compliance filing in Docket Nos. EL05-102, </font><u><font size=2>et</font></u><font size=2> </font><u><font size=2>al</font></u><font size=2>., </font><u><font size=2>Southern Company Services, Inc.</font></u><font size=2>, 119 FERC &#182; 61,065 (2007).</font></p>

<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>

<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="644" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="515" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Southern Company Services, Inc.</font></p> </td>
        <td width="129" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Original Sheet No. 7</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Second Revised Rate Schedule FERC Number 138</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><font size=2>consistent with the Standards of Conduct, will not receive non-public transmission information. The IIC (including Operating Committee membership) is not to serve as a means whereby non-public transmission information is shared in a manner contrary to the Commission&#146;s Standards of Conduct.  Further, Southern Power Company is to be treated as an Energy Affiliate under the Commission&#146;s Standards of Conduct and therefore cannot receive any non-public transmission information. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 4.5 &#150; Operating Committee Discretion</font></u><font size=2>:  Certain provisions of the Manual afford a degree of latitude to the Operating Committee with regard to decisions that it is authorized to make thereunder.  When such discretion is exercised, the AGENT will summarize the decision in an informational filing to be submitted to the Commission within ten (10) business days. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 4.6 &#150; Designation of AGENT</font></u><font size=2>:  SCS, as a party to this IIC, is designated as AGENT of the OPERATING COMPANIES for purposes of this IIC.  In addition, SCS may serve as AGENT and represent the OPERATING COMPANIES, or any of them, in all things to be done in the execution of and operation under existing contracts with nonaffiliated utilities or entities (hereinafter referred to as &#147;OTHERS&#148;), or contracts supplemental thereto. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 4.7 &#150; Duties of AGENT</font></u><font size=2>:  The AGENT is responsible for all administrative and coordination functions in order to effectuate the terms and conditions of this IIC.  From time to time, the OPERATING COMPANIES, or any of them, may also have contracts with OTHERS that provide for the purchase and/or sale of capacity and/or energy by the OPERATING COMPANIES.  The AGENT will make the payments associated with purchases under these contracts and under any other contracts or arrangements under which it acts as agent for the OPERATING COMPANIES.  Each </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="643" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="501" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Issued by:  Charles D. Long, IV, V.P., Fleet Operations &amp; Trading</font></p> </td>
        <td width="141" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Effective: May 1, 2007</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Issued on:  May 18, 2007</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Filed pursuant to order dated April 19, 2007 accepting compliance filing in Docket Nos.         <td width="129" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Original Sheet No. 8</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Second Revised Rate Schedule FERC Number 138</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><font size=2>OPERATING COMPANY will reimburse the AGENT for its portion of such total payments in accordance with the arrangement in effect with respect to the particular contract.  Similarly, the AGENT will collect the payments due for sales under these contracts (and under any other contracts or arrangements under which it acts as agent) and will distribute such payments among the OPERATING COMPANIES in accordance with the arrangement in effect with respect  to the particular contract. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 4.8 &#150; Term of Agency</font></u><font size=2>:  The provisions of this IIC providing for authority for the AGENT to act on behalf of the OPERATING COMPANIES, or any of them, shall be deemed to refer, insofar as applicable, to all contracts under which the AGENT acts as agent for the OPERATING COMPANIES and, notwithstanding anything to the contrary in ARTICLE II hereof, this IIC shall continue in effect insofar as it pertains to other contracts under which the AGENT acts as agent for the OPERATING COMPANIES during the life of any such contracts.  The OPERATING COMPANIES may, however, designate a new agent to act hereunder by giving thirty (30) days written notice thereof to the AGENT, whereupon such new agent shall be the AGENT hereunder. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:12pt;text-align:center;'><u><b><font SIZE=2>ARTICLE V - OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE OF</font></b></u></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:6pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><u><b><font SIZE=2>ELECTRIC GENERATING FACILITIES</font></b></u></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 5.1</font></u><font size=2>:  The OPERATING COMPANIES agree to maintain their respective electric generating facilities in good operating condition and to operate such facilities in coordination with those of the other OPERATING COMPANIES as an integrated electric system in accordance with determinations made from time to time by the Operating Committee in order that an adequate power supply shall be available to meet the requirements of the customers of the respective parties hereto at </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="643" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="501" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Issued by:  Charles D. Long, IV, V.P., Fleet Operations &amp; Trading</font></p> </td>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Second Revised Rate Schedule FERC Number 138</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><font size=2>the lowest cost consistent with a high degree of service reliability. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 5.2</font></u><font size=2>:  With respect to its participation in this IIC, Southern Power Company may have access to information regarding the operation of its own plants or other generation resources (such as those acquired by contract) that it has committed to the Pool (&#147;Pool resources&#148;), but it may not otherwise have access to information regarding the operation of Pool resources of the other OPERATING COMPANIES.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:12pt;text-align:center;'><u><b><font SIZE=2>ARTICLE VI - INCORPORATION OF THE ALLOCATION METHODOLOGY</font></b></u></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:6pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><u><b><font SIZE=2>AND PERIODIC RATE COMPUTATION MANUAL</font></b></u></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 6.1 &#150; Incorporation of Manual</font></u><font size=2>:  The mechanics and methods for determining the charges for reserve sharing capacity and for energy purchased and sold between the OPERATING COMPANIES, the monthly capability requirement determinations, and the monthly billings and payments between the OPERATING COMPANIES are described in detail in the Allocation Methodology and Periodic Rate Computation Manual (&#147;Manual&#148;) attached hereto and incorporated herein by reference.  The Manual also supplies more detailed explanation of provisions of this IIC and is necessary to effectuate its intent. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 6.2 &#150; Purpose of Manual</font></u><font size=2>:  The Manual contains a description of the methodology and procedure used to calculate the charges provided for in this IIC.  The OPERATING COMPANIES recognize that the costs underlying these charges will change during the term of this IIC for reasons such as changes in loads, investment and expenses, as well as the addition of electric generating resources.  Thus, in order for the OPERATING COMPANIES to share equitably in the costs </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="644" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="508" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Southern Company Services, Inc.</font></p> </td>
        <td width="136" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Original Sheet No. 10</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Second Revised Rate Schedule FERC Number 138</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><font size=2>associated with this IIC, it will be necessary to revise or update, on a periodic basis, the cost, expense, load and investment figures utilized in the derivation of the charges hereunder.  The Manual will serve as a formula rate allowing for periodic revision of the charges to reflect changes in the underlying cost components. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 6.3 &#150; Revision of Charges and Regulatory Filings</font></u><font size=2>:  The Manual provides that charges derived by application of the formula rate will be shown on Informational Schedules.  Since the charges under this IIC will be computed in accordance with the formula rate method and procedures established in the Manual, these submissions will not be initial rates or changes in rates that would require a filing and suspension under the Federal Power Act and the applicable Rules and Regulations of the Commission.  On or before November 1 of each year, the Informational Schedules will be submitted to the Commission for informational purposes to show the application of the formula rate and the resulting charges.  Work papers will also be included showing a detailed application of the formula rate contained in the Manual. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 6.4 &#150; Revision of Manual</font></u><font size=2>:  If the Operating Committee determines that revisions to the formula rate are appropriate or necessary, it will direct the AGENT to file the revised Manual with the Commission in order to obtain timely approval or acceptance thereof.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:12pt;text-align:center;'><u><b><font SIZE=2>ARTICLE VII - INTERCHANGE CAPACITY</font></b></u></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:6pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><u><b><font SIZE=2>TRANSACTIONS BETWEEN THE OPERATING COMPANIES</font></b></u></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 7.1 &#150; Provision for Sharing of Temporary Surpluses or Deficits of Capacity Between Operating Companies</font></u><font size=2>:  It is a fundamental premise of this IIC that each OPERATING COMPANY </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="643" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="501" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Issued by:  Charles D. Long, IV, V.P., Fleet Operations &amp; Trading</font></p> </td>
        <td width="141" valign=top >

<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="644" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="508" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Southern Company Services, Inc.</font></p> </td>
        <td width="136" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Original Sheet No. 11</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Second Revised Rate Schedule FERC Number 138</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><font size=2>is expected to have adequate resources to reliably serve its own obligations.  Nevertheless, the OPERATING COMPANIES recognize that in any given year one or more of them may have a temporary surplus or deficit of capacity as a result of coordinated planning or by virtue of load uncertainty, unit availability, and other such circumstances.  It is among the purposes of this IIC to share among the OPERATING COMPANIES the benefits and burdens of their coordinated system operations, including the cost associated with such capacity (&#147;Reserve Sharing&#148;).  Reserve Sharing among the OPERATING COMPANIES is accomplished pursuant to transactions (referred to as &#147;purchases&#148; and &#147;sales&#148;) effectuated on a monthly basis in accordance with ARTICLES IV and V of the Manual. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 7.2 &#150; Charge for Monthly Reserve Sharing Among the OPERATING COMPANIES</font></u><font size=2>:  The OPERATING COMPANIES recognize that capacity reserves in the Pool are predominantly made up of peaking plant or equivalent purchased resources.  Accordingly, the monthly charge for Reserve Sharing among the OPERATING COMPANIES will be based on the most recently acquired peaking plant resource that is available for year-round operation and scheduling. Each OPERATING COMPANY&#146;s monthly charge for reserve capacity sold to the Pool is developed in accordance with the formula rate set out in ARTICLE V of the Manual.  The monthly capacity charge for each OPERATING COMPANY, as developed in accordance with such formula rate, will be shown on Informational Schedules.  Each selling OPERATING COMPANY will sell at its charge shown on such Informational Schedules and the buying
OPERATING COMPANIES will purchase at the weighted average charge of the sellers.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="643" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="501" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Issued by:  Charles D. Long, IV, V.P., Fleet Operations &amp; Trading</font></p> </td>
        <td width="141" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Effective: May 1, 2007</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Issued on:  May 18, 2007</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="644" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="508" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Southern Company Services, Inc.</font></p> </td>
        <td width="136" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Original Sheet No. 12</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Second Revised Rate Schedule FERC Number 138</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:12pt;text-align:center;'><u><b><font SIZE=2>ARTICLE VIII - INTERCHANGE ENERGY TRANSACTIONS</font></b></u></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:6pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><u><b><font SIZE=2>BETWEEN THE OPERATING COMPANIES</font></b></u></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 8.1 &#150; Provision for Interchange Energy</font></u><font size=2>:  Coordinated system operation, utilizing principles of centralized integrated system economic dispatch, results in energy transfers among the OPERATING COMPANIES.  Such energy transfers are accounted for on an hourly basis and are referred to as &#147;Interchange Energy.&#148;  The methodology for determining the amount of Interchange Energy supplied to or purchased from the Pool is set out in ARTICLE II of the Manual.  Interchange Energy is composed of the following two categories: (i) Associated Interchange Energy (energy purchased or sold to serve an OPERATING COMPANY&#146;s obligations other than those related to opportunity sales); and (ii) Opportunity Interchange Energy (energy purchased or sold to meet an OPERATING COMPANY&#146;s responsibility for opportunity sales). </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 8.2 &#150; Charge for Interchange Energy</font></u><font size=2>:  The charge for Interchange Energy sales by an OPERATING COMPANY during any hour will be based on the variable costs of the generating resources that are considered as having supplied the Interchange Energy. The methodology for determining the charges for Associated and Opportunity Interchange Energy sales to the Pool during any hour is set out in ARTICLE III of the Manual.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:6pt; margin-top:12pt;text-align:center;'><u><b><font SIZE=2>ARTICLE IX - PROVISION FOR OTHER INTERCHANGE TRANSACTIONS</font></b></u></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 9.1 &#150; Assignable Energy</font></u><font size=2>:  Assignable Energy is defined as energy derived from internal sources or from OTHERS at a cost that renders it unusable from an economic dispatch perspective.  </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="643" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="501" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Issued by:  Charles D. Long, IV, V.P., Fleet Operations &amp; Trading</font></p> </td>
        <td width="141" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Effective: May 1, 2007</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Issued on:  May 18, 2007</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Filed pursuant to order dated April 19, 2007 accepting compliance filing in Docket Nos. EL05-102, </font><u><font size=2>et</font></u><font size=2> </font><u><font size=2>al</font></u><font size=2>., </font><u><font size=2>Southern Company Services, Inc.</font></u><font size=2>, 119 FERC &#182; 61,065 (2007).</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>



<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="644" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="508" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Southern Company Services, Inc.</font></p> </td>
        <td width="136" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Original Sheet No. 13</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Second Revised Rate Schedule FERC Number 138</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><font size=2>Assignable Energy is assigned to one or more of the OPERATING COMPANIES consistent with the purpose for which it is acquired.  Such assignment will be accomplished by first identifying the beneficiary (or beneficiaries) of the Assignable Energy and then determining the appropriate share for each such OPERATING COMPANY.  For example, these shares might be based on a Peak Period Load Ratio (&#147;PPLR&#148;) in proportion to the PPLRs of other beneficiaries or weighted participation in a bilateral sale.  Once assigned, Assignable Energy will not be delivered to the Pool unless it becomes economically usable on the integrated system. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 9.2 &#150; Hydroelectric Operation During Periods of Minimum Steam Operations</font></u><font size=2>:  During certain periods of the year when unusually good flow conditions prevail, certain steam generating units may be taken out of service to increase the utilization of hydro energy.  The OPERATING COMPANY having such hydro generation may elect to take a fossil fired generating unit out of service.  In the alternative, if another OPERATING COMPANY takes a fossil fired generating unit out of service for the purpose of utilizing such hydro energy, the energy rate between the two OPERATING COMPANIES for that transaction will be the average of the operation and maintenance cost of such hydro energy and the variable cost of the fossil fired generating unit. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 9.3 &#150; Tie-Line Frequency Regulation by Hydro Capacity</font></u><font size=2>:  Tie-line load control and frequency regulation by hydro involves additional costs because of increased expenditures associated with such regulation.  The charge for these transactions is computed in accordance with the formula rate contained in ARTICLE VI of the Manual. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 9.4 &#150; Pool Transactions with OTHERS</font></u><font size=2>:  Capacity and energy transactions with OTHERS </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="643" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="501" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Issued by:  Charles D. Long, IV, V.P., Fleet Operations &amp; Trading</font></p> </td>
        <td width="141" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Effective: May 1, 2007</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Issued on:  May 18, 2007</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Filed pursuant to order dated April 19, 2007 accepting compliance filing in Docket Nos. <p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="644" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="508" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Southern Company Services, Inc.</font></p> </td>
        <td width="136" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Original Sheet No. 14</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Second Revised Rate Schedule FERC Number 138</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><font size=2>that are entered into on behalf of the Pool will be governed by the following principles:</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 9.4.1 &#150; Pool Purchases of Capacity and Energy</font></u><font size=2>:  The AGENT may periodically purchase capacity and energy from OTHERS for the benefit of the integrated system.  Such Pool purchases will initially be allocated at cost to all OPERATING COMPANIES in proportion to their PPLRs, as provided for in ARTICLE X of this IIC.  Purchases so allocated may be sold as Interchange Energy when they are economically usable on the integrated system.  Adjustments may thereafter be made in order to reconcile any inequitable effects of this process among the OPERATING COMPANIES, with the intent being that none of the individual OPERATING COMPANIES should be adversely impacted by a purchase that benefits the system as a whole.  These impacts will be determined through a system simulation that calculates each OPERATING COMPANY&#146;s cost of generation that
is avoided by the purchase.  This avoided cost will be compared on an hourly basis to the cost of the purchase.  To the extent the avoided cost exceeds the purchase cost, the effect is &#147;positive&#148; (</font><u><font size=2>i.e.</font></u><font size=2>, cost savings) for that hour.  These hourly results will be summed to determine the effect on each OPERATING COMPANY for the day.  In situations where individual OPERATING COMPANIES are adversely impacted by a purchase that benefits the system as a whole, such adverse impacts will be offset through a proportional reduction in the positive net benefits realized by the other OPERATING COMPANIES.  In the event the net result for the day is negative, that result is shared among the OPERATING COMPANIES on a PPLR basis.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 9.4.2 &#150; Pool Sales of Capacity and Energy</font></u><font size=2>:  The AGENT may from time to time arrange for the sale to OTHERS of capacity and energy available to the Pool at rates provided for in contracts or at rates mutually agreed upon.  The capacity and/or energy obligation for the sale, as </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="643" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="501" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Issued by:  Charles D. Long, IV, V.P., Fleet Operations &amp; Trading</font></p> </td>
        <td width="141" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Effective: May 1, 2007</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Issued on:  May 18, 2007</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

EL05-102, </font><u><font size=2>et</font></u><font size=2> </font><u><font size=2>al</font></u><font size=2>., </font><u><font size=2>Southern Company Services, Inc.</font></u><font size=2>, 119 FERC &#182; 61,065 (2007).</font></p>

<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="644" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="508" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Southern Company Services, Inc.</font></p> </td>
        <td width="136" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Original Sheet No. 15</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Second Revised Rate Schedule FERC Number 138</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><font size=2>well as the associated cost, is allocated to each OPERATING COMPANY on a PPLR basis.  Payments by OTHERS are also distributed to the respective OPERATING COMPANIES on the basis of PPLRs. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><font size=2>The Pool has the exclusive right to use generation resources committed to the Pool (&#147;Pool resources&#148;) to engage in opportunity transactions with OTHERS that would begin and end during the period from the current hour through Friday (midnight) of the following week.  Neither Southern Power Company nor any of the other OPERATING COMPANIES can use Pool resources for its own benefit in those wholesale opportunity markets.  To the extent Southern Power Company engages in other transactions solely for its own benefit, it must do so using personnel (staff) separate from the personnel (staff) that conducts similar activities on behalf of the other OPERATING COMPANIES. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:6pt; margin-top:12pt;text-align:center;'><u><b><font size=2>ARTICLE X &#150; UTILIZATION OF PEAK-PERIOD LOAD RATIOS</font></b></u></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 10.1 &#150; Certain Allocations and Payments to be Based on Peak-Period Load Ratios</font></u><font size=2>:  The AGENT is responsible for the annual development of Peak-Period Load Ratios (&#147;PPLRs&#148;) for each of the OPERATING COMPANIES.  These PPLRs will be utilized for allocation of certain costs, payments, receipts and other obligations, as provided for in this IIC or the Manual.  The procedure and methodology for developing the PPLRs are set out in ARTICLE I of the Manual and the resulting PPLR values are shown on an Informational Schedule. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="643" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="501" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Issued by:  Charles D. Long, IV, V.P., Fleet Operations &amp; Trading</font></p> </td>
        <td width="141" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Effective: May 1, 2007</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Issued on:  May 18, 2007</font></p>

            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Southern Company Services, Inc.</font></p> </td>
        <td width="136" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Original Sheet No. 16</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Second Revised Rate Schedule FERC Number 138</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;line-height:200%;'><u><b><font SIZE=2>ARTICLE XI - TRANSMISSION SERVICE</font></b></u></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 11.1 &#150; Applicability of Network Integration Transmission Service</font></u><font size=2>:  Network Integration Transmission Service (&#147;Network Service&#148;) provides for the integration, economic dispatch and regulation of current and planned Network Resources to serve Network Load.  Since the OPERATING COMPANIES integrate, economically dispatch and regulate their generating resources to serve their bundled and grandfathered native load (&#147;Native Load&#148;) pursuant to this IIC, the associated use of the transmission system is in the nature of Network Service.  Except for provisions related to rates and charges, the transmission service provided to these Native Load customers is comparable to Network Service under the Open Access Transmission Tariff (&#147;OATT&#148;).  Since the OPERATING COMPANIES&#146; Native Load is specifically included in the determination of
the load used to derive the charge for Network Service under the OATT, the OPERATING COMPANIES are bearing a cost responsibility for transactions hereunder comparable to that assigned to other Network Customers. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:6pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 11.2 &#150; Transmission Service for Other Transactions</font></u><font size=2>:  All transmission service provided to any or all of the OPERATING COMPANIES (other than service to their Native Load, as described in Section 11.1) is subject to the OATT in all respects, including adherence to the same rates, terms and conditions applicable to other market participants.  Any such transmission service will be obtained pursuant to the OATT and/or from other transmission providers.  Southern Power Company specifically commits to take all of its transmission service under the OATT of Southern Companies or from other transmission providers.  </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="643" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="501" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Issued by:  Charles D. Long, IV, V.P., Fleet Operations &amp; Trading</font></p> </td>
        <td width="141" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Effective: May 1, 2007</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Issued on:  May 18, 2007</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="644" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="508" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Southern Company Services, Inc.</font></p> </td>
        <td width="136" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Original Sheet No. 17</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Second Revised Rate Schedule FERC Number 138</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:6pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;line-height:200%;'><u><b><font SIZE=2>ARTICLE XII - BILLING AND PAYMENT</font></b></u></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 12.1 &#150; Recording and Billing of Energy Transactions</font></u><font size=2>:  Each OPERATING COMPANY will transmit to the AGENT such data and other information for each hour of the year as is necessary to develop accounting and monthly billing for the various energy transactions specified under this IIC.  The AGENT is responsible for assembling all of the data and information and for preparing intercompany energy billing for each month in accordance with the provisions of this IIC.  The bills shall contain such details as required to permit review and verification by the OPERATING COMPANIES. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 12.2 &#150; Month-End Adjustment of Daily Energy Determinations</font></u><font size=2>:  It is recognized that the sum of the daily totals of receipts and deliveries (which are based on instantaneous integrated meters) will not exactly equal corresponding amounts determined at month-end (which are based on accumulating meters).  Such differences in energy receipts and deliveries are billed or credited to each OPERATING COMPANY at the average cost of Associated Interchange Energy to the Pool for the month. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 12.3 &#150; Billing for Reserve Sharing Transactions</font></u><font size=2>:  The AGENT is responsible for preparing a monthly bill to the OPERATING COMPANIES for all capacity transactions related to Reserve Sharing, as contemplated by this IIC.  The bill shall contain such details as required to permit review and verification by the OPERATING COMPANIES. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="643" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="501" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Issued by:  Charles D. Long, IV, V.P., Fleet Operations &amp; Trading</font></p> </td>
        <td width="141" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Effective: May 1, 2007</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Issued on:  May 18, 2007</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Filed pursuant to order dated April 19, 2007 accepting compliance filing in Docket Nos. EL05-102, </font><u><font size=2>et</font></u><font size=2> </font><u><font size=2>al</font></u><font size=2>., </font><u><font size=2>Southern Company Services, Inc.</font></u><font size=2>, 119 FERC &#182; 61,065 (2007).</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="644" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="508" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Southern Company Services, Inc.</font></p> </td>
        <td width="136" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Original Sheet No. 18</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Second Revised Rate Schedule FERC Number 138</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 12.4 &#150; Billing and Payment Date</font></u><font size=2>:  The AGENT renders all bills provided for in this IIC not later than the 10th day of the billing month.  All payments by the OPERATING COMPANIES are made by the 20th day of the billing month. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 12.5 &#150; Billing Corrections</font></u><font size=2>:  If the AGENT discovers missing or erroneous data of a material nature pertaining to prior billings, a correction adjustment applicable to those billings will be based on the period affected by such missing or erroneous data, but not to exceed  forty-five (45) days from the date of such discovery (&#147;correction period&#148;).  If the correction period is forty-five days, then the period actually used for the calculation will extend to the beginning of the billing month in which the forty-five day period falls.  Interest does not accrue on any such adjustment.  The resulting billing correction will be applied as soon as practicable to the regular monthly bill. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;line-height:200%;'><b><font size=2>[REST OF PAGE INTENTIONALLY LEFT BLANK]</font></b></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'>
</p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

    <tr >
        <td width="508" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Southern Company Services, Inc.</font></p> </td>
        <td width="136" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Original Sheet No. 20</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Second Revised Rate Schedule FERC Number 138</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><b><font SIZE=2>ALLOCATION METHODOLOGY AND PERIODIC</font></b></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:6pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><u><b><font SIZE=2>RATE COMPUTATION PROCEDURE MANUAL</font></b></u></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 0.0 &#150; Description and Purpose of Manual</font></u><font size=2>:  This Manual is provided for in the Southern Company System Intercompany Interchange Contract (&#147;IIC&#148;) entered into the 1</font><sup><font size=2>st</font></sup><font size=2> day of  May, 2007, and contains a formula description of the methodology and procedure used to calculate the charges under the IIC.  The Manual is divided into six (6) basic articles as follows: </font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="75%" style='margin-left:.7in;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="222" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font SIZE=2>ARTICLE I</font></p> </td>
        <td width="18" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>-</font></p> </td>
        <td width="240" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Methodology for Determination of Peak-Period Load Ratios</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="222" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="18" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="240" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="222" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font SIZE=2>ARTICLE II</font></p> </td>
        <td width="18" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>-</font></p> </td>
        <td width="240" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Methodology for Determination of Amount of Interchange Energy Sold To and Purchased From the Pool</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="222" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="18" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="240" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="222" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font SIZE=2>ARTICLE III</font></p> </td>
        <td width="18" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>-</font></p> </td>
        <td width="240" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Rates for Interchange Energy </font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="222" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="18" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="240" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="222" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font SIZE=2>ARTICLE IV</font></p> </td>
        <td width="18" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>-</font></p> </td>
        <td width="240" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Methodology for Determination of Monthly Amount of Reserve Sharing Capacity To Be Sold To or Purchased From the Pool</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="222" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="18" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="240" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="222" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font SIZE=2>ARTICLE V</font></p> </td>
        <td width="18" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>-</font></p> </td>
        <td width="240" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Rate for Monthly Reserve Sharing Capacity for Each Operating Company</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="222" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="18" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="240" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="222" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font SIZE=2>ARTICLE VI</font></p> </td>
        <td width="18" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>-</font></p> </td>
        <td width="240" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Rate for Tie-Line Load Control and Frequency Regulation by Hydro Facilities</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:2.5in; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="644" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="508" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Southern Company Services, Inc.</font></p> </td>
        <td width="136" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Original Sheet No. 21</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Second Revised Rate Schedule FERC Number 138</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;line-height: 150%;'><b><font SIZE=2>ARTICLE I</font></b></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><b><font SIZE=2>METHODOLOGY FOR </font></b></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:6pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><u><b><font SIZE=2>DETERMINATION OF PEAK-PERIOD LOAD RATIOS</font></b></u></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 1.1 &#150; Provision for Peak-Period Load Ratios</font></u><font size=2>:  This article of the Manual establishes and provides for the annual derivation of Peak-Period Load Ratios (&#147;PPLRs&#148;) that are utilized in energy and capacity transactions and in other allocations as provided for in the IIC. These ratios are shown on Informational Schedule No. 1. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 1.2 &#150; Methodology for Determining Peak-Period Load Ratios</font></u><font size=2>:  The Contract Year in the IIC is defined as January 1st through December 31st.  The peak period is defined as the fourteen (14) hours between 7:00 a.m. and 9:00 p.m. (Prevailing Central Time) of each weekday, excluding holidays.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><font size=2>The Peak-Period Load Ratios for the Contract Year are based upon the prior year&#146;s actual peak period energy in the months of June, July, and August for each OPERATING COMPANY.  The system peak period energy is equal to the sum of all the OPERATING COMPANIES&#146; peak period energy, excluding: (i) opportunity transactions with OTHERS that would begin and end during the period from the current hour through Friday (midnight) of the following week; and (ii) any energy sales transactions that are settled on a financial basis. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><font size=2>The Peak-Period Load Ratios are determined by dividing each OPERATING COMPANY's summation of the June, July, and August actual weekday peak-period energy by the total system June, July, and August actual weekday peak-period energy.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'>
</p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="643" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="501" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Issued by:  Charles D. Long, IV, V.P., Fleet Operations &amp; Trading</font></p> </td>
        <td width="141" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Effective: May 1, 2007</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Issued on:  May 18, 2007</font></p>
