<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Second Revised Rate Schedule FERC Number 138</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;line-height:200%;'><b><font SIZE=2>ARTICLE II</font></b></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><b><font SIZE=2>METHODOLOGY FOR</font></b></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><b><font SIZE=2>DETERMINATION OF AMOUNT OF INTERCHANGE</font></b></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:6pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><u><b><font SIZE=2>ENERGY SOLD TO AND PURCHASED FROM THE POOL</font></b></u></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:6pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 2.1 &#150; Methodology for Determination of Amounts of Interchange Energy</font></u><font size=2>:  Interchange Energy is composed of the following two categories: (i) Associated Interchange Energy (energy purchased or sold to serve an OPERATING COMPANY&#146;s obligations other than those related to opportunity sales); and (ii) Opportunity Interchange Energy (energy purchased or sold to meet an OPERATING COMPANY&#146;s responsibility for opportunity sales). </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 2.1.1 &#150; Determination of Associated Interchange Energy</font></u><font size=2>:  The amount of Associated Interchange Energy purchased or sold is computed hourly on the basis of the following:</font></p>


<table  border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style='margin-left:.5in;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="48" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>1.</font></p> </td>
        <td  valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Net receipts and deliveries, which is the total of energy delivered by each OPERATING COMPANY to all other OPERATING COMPANIES and to OTHERS, less the total of energy received by each OPERATING COMPANY from all other OPERATING COMPANIES and from OTHERS;</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table  border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style='margin-left:.5in;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="48" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>2.</font></p> </td>
        <td  valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Adjustments for schedules of the OPERATING COMPANIES and OTHERS, for energy movements received from or delivered to sources within or outside the territory of the OPERATING COMPANIES and settled for under arrangements made for such energy movements;</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.5in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table  border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style='margin-left:.5in;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="48" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>3.</font></p> </td>
        <td  valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Adjustments for Opportunity Interchange Energy, as determined pursuant to Section 2.1.2 below; and</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="48" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>4.</font></p> </td>
        <td  valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Adjustments to account for: (i)  the effects of remote generation to which an OPERATING COMPANY is entitled and remote load for which an OPERATING COMPANY is responsible; and (ii) hydro energy losses due to tie-line frequency regulation.</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 2.1.2 &#150; Determination of Opportunity Interchange Energy</font></u><font size=2>:  The amount of Opportunity Interchange Energy purchased or sold is computed hourly for each opportunity sale in </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="643" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="501" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Issued by:  Charles D. Long, IV, V.P., Fleet Operations &amp; Trading</font></p> </td>
        <td width="141" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Effective: May 1, 2007</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Issued on:  May 18, 2007</font></p>

<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="644" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="508" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Southern Company Services, Inc.</font></p> </td>
        <td width="136" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Original Sheet No. 23</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Second Revised Rate Schedule FERC Number 138</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><font size=2>order to account for the difference between an OPERATING COMPANY&#146;s responsibility for an opportunity sale and the amount of energy actually generated by that OPERATING COMPANY in connection with such sale.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:12pt;text-align:center;line-height: 150%;'><b><font SIZE=2>ARTICLE III</font></b></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:6pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><u><b><font SIZE=2>RATES FOR INTERCHANGE ENERGY</font></b></u></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 3.1 &#150; Procedure for Economic Dispatch</font></u><font size=2>:  Centralized economic dispatch is accomplished by dispatching system generating resources and purchases to meet the obligations of the OPERATING COMPANIES and to supply energy for sales to OTHERS.  System generating resources are dispatched based on marginal replacement fuel cost, variable operation and maintenance expenses, in-plant fuel handling costs, emission allowance replacement costs, compensation for transmission losses, and other such energy related costs that would otherwise not have been incurred.  A purchase is recognized in economic dispatch on the basis of its energy cost.  The above-referenced cost components are collectively referred to as the &#147;variable dispatch cost.&#148;</font><font size=2> </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 3.2 &#150; Associated Interchange Energy Rate</font></u><font size=2>: The Associated Interchange Energy Rate, as determined for each hour, is based on the variable dispatch cost of the incremental resource(s) that serve the collective obligations of the OPERATING COMPANIES.  For each hour, an OPERATING COMPANY supplying Associated Interchange Energy to the Pool will receive a payment determined by multiplying the applicable Associated Interchange Energy Rate by the quantity of kilowatt-hours sold to the Pool.  For each hour, an OPERATING COMPANY purchasing Associated Interchange </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="643" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="501" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Issued by:  Charles D. Long, IV, V.P., Fleet Operations &amp; Trading</font></p> </td>
        <td width="141" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Effective: May 1, 2007</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Issued on:  May 18, 2007</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Filed pursuant to order dated April 19, 2007 accepting compliance filing in Docket Nos. EL05-102, </font><u><font size=2>et</font></u><font size=2> </font><u><font size=2>al</font></u><font size=2>., </font><u><font size=2>Southern Company Services, Inc.</font></u><font size=2>, 119 FERC &#182; 61,065 (2007).</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<!-- PAGEBREAK -->
<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="644" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="508" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Southern Company Services, Inc.</font></p> </td>
        <td width="136" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Original Sheet No. 24</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Second Revised Rate Schedule FERC Number 138</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><font size=2>Energy from the Pool will be charged an amount determined by multiplying the Associated Interchange Energy Rate by the quantity of kilowatt-hours purchased from the Pool. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 3.3 &#150; Opportunity Interchange Energy Rate</font></u><font size=2>:  The Opportunity Interchange Energy Rate, as determined for each hour, is based on the variable dispatch cost of the resources that supplied such energy in connection with a given opportunity sale.  This rate will be applied to each OPERATING COMPANY&#146;s energy obligation for that transaction to derive the payment due from such OPERATING COMPANY.  The resulting payments will then be used to reimburse the cost of the OPERATING COMPANIES that supplied the Opportunity Interchange Energy. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 3.3.1 &#150; Opportunity Interchange Energy Rates Related to Certain Contracts and Other Obligations of the Operating Companies</font></u><font size=2>:  The OPERATING COMPANIES are currently obligated to supply various types of energy under certain contracts with Florida Power &amp; Light Company, Jacksonville Electric Authority, Florida Power Corporation, and South Mississippi Electric Power Association.  For purposes of these contracts, the variable dispatch cost of resources supplying the energy shall be the same as described in Section 3.1 of the Manual, except that blended replacement fuel cost will be used instead of marginal replacement fuel cost. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 3.4 &#150; Variable Operation and Maintenance Expenses For Fossil Fired Units</font></u><font size=2>:  The variable Operation and Maintenance expenses for fossil fired units for the Contract Year are derived by summing the following budgeted/forecasted components for each unit:  (i) all operating material, non-labor, and on-site contract labor charged to FERC Accounts 502 and 505 (Fossil Steam); and (ii) all maintenance material, non-labor, and contract labor charged to FERC Accounts 512 and 513 </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="643" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="501" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Issued by:  Charles D. Long, IV, V.P., Fleet Operations &amp; Trading</font></p> </td>
        <td width="141" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Effective: May 1, 2007</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Issued on:  May 18, 2007</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="644" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="508" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Southern Company Services, Inc.</font></p> </td>
        <td width="136" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Original Sheet No. 25</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Second Revised Rate Schedule FERC Number 138</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><font size=2>(Fossil Steam), and 553 (Combustion Turbine).  These budgeted expense estimates may be levelized over the major maintenance cycle of a particular unit or set of units.  The estimated expenses are divided by the estimated net energy output of each unit to convert the values to dollars per megawatt-hour.  The variable Operation and Maintenance expense for each fossil fired unit is shown on Informational Schedule No. 2 for the Contract Year. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 3.4.1 &#150; In-Plant Fuel Handling Costs for Fossil Fired Units</font></u><font size=2>:  In-Plant fuel handling costs for each fossil fired unit for the Contract Year are based on the budgeted/forecasted expenditures for in-plant fuel handling expenses charged to FERC Account 501.  These budgeted expense estimates may be levelized over the major maintenance cycle of a particular unit or set of units.  The estimated expenses are divided by the estimated net energy output of each unit to convert the values to dollars per megawatt-hour.  The in-plant fuel handling cost for each fossil fired unit is shown on Informational Schedule No. 2 for the Contract Year. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 3.5 &#150; Blended Replacement Fuel Cost</font></u><font size=2>:  Blended replacement fuel costs are determined monthly by the AGENT and are defined as the weighted average cost, escalated for the current dispatch period, of fuel receipts for the previous month (both long-term contract and spot market receipts) and the projected fuel receipts for the current month. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 3.6 &#150; Marginal Replacement Fuel Cost</font></u><font size=2>:  Marginal replacement fuel costs for coal are determined at least monthly by the AGENT and reflect the current market price for additional coal needed at a generating facility at the time of such need.  For natural gas or oil-fired units, the marginal replacement fuel costs are updated each business day based upon next day market prices. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="643" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >

        <td width="141" valign=top >

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 3.7 &#150; Emission Allowance Replacement Costs</font></u><font size=2>:  The replacement costs of emission allowances are determined at least monthly by the AGENT and reflect the current market value of such allowances. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 3.8 &#150; Revisions in Methodologies</font></u><font size=2>:   The procedures described in Sections 3.6 and 3.7 will be periodically reviewed by the AGENT and may be revised upon the approval of the Operating Committee.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:12pt;text-align:center;line-height: 150%;'><b><font SIZE=2>ARTICLE IV</font></b></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><b><font SIZE=2>METHODOLOGY FOR DETERMINATION OF</font></b></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><b><font SIZE=2>MONTHLY AMOUNT OF RESERVE SHARING</font></b></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:6pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><u><b><font SIZE=2>CAPACITY TO BE SOLD TO OR PURCHASED FROM THE POOL</font></b></u></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:center;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 4.1 &#150; Formula for Determination of Monthly Reserve Sharing Capacity Sales/Purchases</font></u><font size=2>:  The monthly capacity sale to or purchase from the Pool for each OPERATING COMPANY for reserve sharing purposes is determined from the following formula:</font></p>

    <tr >
        <td width="85" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:162%'><font size=2>CS or CP </font></p> </td>
        <td width="36" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>

            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:162%'><font SIZE=2>RS - R</font></p> </td> </tr>

    <tr >
        <td width="85" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>CS or CP</font></p> </td>
        <td width="36" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>

        <td width="378" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Capacity sales to the Pool (CS) or capacity purchases from the Pool (CP) by an OPERATING COMPANY for reserve sharing purposes.     <tr style='height:15.25pt'>
        <td width="85" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt; height:15.25pt'>

    <tr >
        <td width="85" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font SIZE=2>RS</font></p> </td>

            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Reserve responsibility for each OPERATING COMPANY (See Section 4.1.1).</font></p> </td> </tr>

        <td width="136" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Original Sheet No. 27</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Second Revised Rate Schedule FERC Number 138</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><font size=2>the integrated electric system is allocated among the OPERATING COMPANIES on the basis of peak hour load ratios for each month.</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="76%" style='margin-left:108.9pt;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="72" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>

        <td width="42" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:162%'><font size=2>=</font></p> </td>
        <td width="372" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:162%'><font size=2>L/L' x R</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="72" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:162%'><font size=2>Where:</font></p> </td>
        <td width="42" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:162%'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="372" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:162%'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="72" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font SIZE=2>RS</font></p> </td>
        <td width="42" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>=</font></p> </td>
        <td width="372" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Reserve responsibility for each OPERATING COMPANY.</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="72" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="42" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="372" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="72" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font SIZE=2>L</font></p> </td>
        <td width="42" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>=</font></p> </td>
        <td width="372" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Monthly peak hour load responsibility of each OPERATING COMPANY (See Section 4.3).</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="72" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>

            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="372" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="72" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font SIZE=2>L'</font></p> </td>
        <td width="42" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>=</font></p> </td>
        <td width="372" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Monthly peak hour load of the integrated electric system (See Section 4.3).</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="72" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="42" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="372" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="72" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font SIZE=2>R</font></p> </td>
        <td width="42" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>=</font></p> </td>
        <td width="372" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Sum of the reserve capacity for all of the OPERATING COMPANIES.</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:2.63in; text-indent:-1.13in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 4.1.2 &#150; Reserve Capacity (R)</font></u><font size=2>:  The reserve capacity for each of the respective OPERATING COMPANIES is determined monthly by the following formula:</font></p>

    <tr >
        <td width="86" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>

            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:162%'><font SIZE=2>C - CR</font></p> </td> </tr>

    <tr >

            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Total capacity available to the OPERATING COMPANY (See Section 4.2).</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="86" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>

            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Total capacity required to meet reliably the OPERATING COMPANY&#146;s load responsibility. </font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><font size=2>The capacity required to meet the OPERATING COMPANY&#146;s load responsibility is determined by the following formula:</font></p>

    <tr >
        <td width="86" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>

            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:162%'><font SIZE=2>LC + LCR</font></p> </td> </tr>

            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:162%'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="86" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>

            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Portion of the total capacity required to meet reliably the OPERATING COMPANY&#146;s load responsibility that is available for load service (&#147;available portion&#148;).</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

        <td width="136" valign=top >

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Second Revised Rate Schedule FERC Number 138</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="77%" style='margin-left:108.9pt;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="86" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font SIZE=2>LCR</font></p> </td>
        <td width="48" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>=</font></p> </td>
        <td width="359" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Portion of the capacity required to meet reliably the OPERATING COMPANY&#146;s load responsibility that is unavailable for load service for any reason (including forced outage, partial outage or maintenance outage) during the ten (10) highest system peak hours during each month averaged over the most recent three-year period (&#147;unavailable portion&#148;).  These unavailable portions of capacity are determined by identifying unavailability specific to each individual OPERATING COMPANY by each generation type.  Individual OPERATING COMPANY unavailability factors for each type of generating capacity will be applied to their respective owned resources in determining their unavailable capacity associated with load service.</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:2.63in; text-indent:-1.13in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in; text-indent:0.25in;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><font size=2>The available portion of the total capacity is determined from the following formula:</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:1in; text-indent:-1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="77%" style='margin-left:108.9pt;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="86" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:162%'><font SIZE=2>LC</font></p> </td>
        <td width="48" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:162%'><font size=2>= </font></p> </td>
        <td width="359" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:162%'><font size=2>RPS + DSO + Cha + Cna + Coa</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="86" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:162%'><font size=2>Where:</font></p> </td>
        <td width="48" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:162%'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="359" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:162%'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="86" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font SIZE=2>RPS</font></p> </td>
        <td width="48" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>=</font></p> </td>
        <td width="359" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Reserved contract purchases from and sales to OTHERS.</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="86" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="48" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="359" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="86" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font SIZE=2>DSO</font></p> </td>
        <td width="48" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font size=2>=</font></p> </td>
        <td width="359" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font size=2>Demand side option equivalent capacity.</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="86" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Cha</font></p> </td>
        <td width="48" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>=</font></p> </td>
        <td width="359" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Total conventional hydro capacity less the unavailable portion of conventional hydro capacity.</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="86" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="48" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="359" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="86" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Cna</font></p> </td>
        <td width="48" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>=</font></p> </td>
        <td width="359" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Total nuclear capacity less the unavailable portion of nuclear capacity.</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="86" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="48" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="359" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="86" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Coa</font></p> </td>
        <td width="48" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>=</font></p> </td>
        <td width="359" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Total available pumped storage hydro, coal, combustion turbine, combined cycle, oil and gas steam, and purchased resource capacity required to meet the remaining portion of the OPERATING COMPANY&#146;s load responsibility, calculated as:  L - RPS - DSO - Cha - Cna.</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:2.63in; text-indent:-1.13in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></td> </tr>

            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Total pumped storage hydro, coal, combustion turbine, combined cycle, oil and gas steam, and purchased resource capacity.</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr>
        <td width="90" ></td>

        <td width="84" ></td>

        <td width="41" ></td>

        <td width="357" ></td>

        <td width="3" ></td> </tr> </table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:2.63in; text-indent:-1.13in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 4.2 &#150; Determination of Capacity Available to Each OPERATING COMPANY (C)</font></u><font size=2>:  The capacity available to each OPERATING COMPANY is determined monthly as the sum of available owned, leased, purchased or otherwise available generating units, reserved contract purchases from and sales to OTHERS, and seasonal or other power exchanges, all as established by the Operating Committee as part of the coordinated planning process.  The capacity available is determined from the following formula:</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="76%" style='margin-left:108.9pt;border-collapse:collapse; '>
    <tr >
        <td width="84" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font SIZE=2>C</font></p> </td>
        <td width="35" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>=</font></p> </td>
        <td width="367" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Cc + Cn + Cog + Ccc + Cp + Cct + Ch + Cpsh + DSO + RPS + PRC</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="84" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:162%'><font size=2>Where:</font></p> </td>
        <td width="35" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:162%'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="367" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:162%'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="84" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font size=2>Cc</font></p> </td>
        <td width="35" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font size=2>=</font></p> </td>
        <td width="367" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font size=2>Coal capacity.</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="84" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font size=2>Cn</font></p> </td>
        <td width="35" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font size=2>=</font></p> </td>
        <td width="367" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font size=2>Nuclear capacity.</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="84" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font size=2>Cog</font></p> </td>
        <td width="35" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font size=2>=</font></p> </td>
        <td width="367" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font size=2>Oil and gas steam capacity.</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="84" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font size=2>Ccc</font></p> </td>
        <td width="35" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font size=2>=</font></p> </td>
        <td width="367" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font size=2>Combined cycle capacity</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="84" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font size=2>Cp</font></p> </td>
        <td width="35" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font size=2>=</font></p> </td>
        <td width="367" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font size=2>Peak Load capacity.</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

    <tr >

        <td width="136" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Original Sheet No. 30</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Second Revised Rate Schedule FERC Number 138</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="76%" style='margin-left:108.9pt;border-collapse:collapse; '>
    <tr >
        <td width="84" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font size=2>Cct</font></p> </td>
        <td width="35" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font size=2>=</font></p> </td>
        <td width="367" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font size=2>Combustion turbine capacity.</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="84" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font size=2>Ch</font></p> </td>
        <td width="35" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font size=2>=</font></p> </td>
        <td width="367" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font size=2>Conventional hydro capacity.</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="84" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font size=2>Cpsh</font></p> </td>
        <td width="35" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font size=2>=</font></p> </td>
        <td width="367" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font size=2>Pumped storage hydro capacity.</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="84" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font SIZE=2>DSO</font></p> </td>
        <td width="35" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font size=2>=</font></p> </td>
        <td width="367" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font size=2>Demand side option equivalent capacity.</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="84" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font SIZE=2>RPS</font></p> </td>
        <td width="35" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font size=2>=</font></p> </td>
        <td width="367" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Reserved contract purchases from and sales to OTHERS.</font></p>
<p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="84" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font SIZE=2>PRC</font></p> </td>
        <td width="35" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font size=2>=</font></p> </td>
        <td width="367" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font size=2>Purchased resource capacity.</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:2.63in; text-indent:-1.13in;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><font size=2>The components of the above formula shall be computed as detailed below.  The capability demonstrated in accordance with such procedures shall be used in establishing the following year's capacity values.  Where seasonal references are made, the seasons shall be defined as follows: Summer (June through September); Fall (October through November); Winter (December through February); and Spring (March through May). </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 4.2.1 &#150; Certified Rating</font></u><font size=2>:  The production officer at each OPERATING COMPANY will certify the full load capability of each coal electric generating unit (excluding units from which Unit Power Sales and other similar bulk power sales are made), oil and gas steam electric generating unit, combined cycle unit, and combustion turbine unit.  Southern Nuclear Operating Company will certify the capability of each nuclear steam electric generating unit.  These certified ratings (&#147;Full Load&#148; ratings) shall represent the full load capability expected to be available continuously on a daily basis, under normal operating conditions, with all units at a given plant operating concurrently.  Where appropriate, certified ratings shall be adjusted to reflect cogeneration and seasonal impacts.  The production officer at each OPERATING
COMPANY will also certify the peak load capability of </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="643" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="501" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Issued by:  Charles D. Long, IV, V.P., Fleet Operations &amp; Trading</font></p> </td>
        <td width="141" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Effective: May 1, 2007</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Issued on:  May 18, 2007</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Filed pursuant to order dated April 19, 2007 accepting compliance filing in Docket Nos. EL05-102, </font><u><font size=2>et</font></u><font size=2> </font><u><font size=2>al</font></u><font size=2>., </font><u><font size=2>Southern Company Services, Inc.</font></u><font size=2>, 119 FERC &#182; 61,065 (2007).</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<P><HR noshade><P>
<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>



<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="644" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="508" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Southern Company Services, Inc.</font></p> </td>
        <td width="136" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Original Sheet No. 31</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Second Revised Rate Schedule FERC Number 138</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><font size=2>generating units demonstrating such capability (&#147;Peak Load&#148; capability).  The Peak Load capability shall represent the additional amount of generation obtained for a limited period of time by operating all units at a given plant concurrently and under conditions such as, but not limited to, overpressure, valves wide open and top feedwater heaters out of service.  These unit ratings will be included in the informational filing submitted in accordance with ARTICLE VI of the IIC.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 4.2.2 &#150; Coal (Cc)and Nuclear (Cn) Capacity</font></u><font size=2>:  The Full Load rating of each coal and nuclear steam electric generating unit shall be based on the unit's capability during hours when such unit demonstrates full output during the months of June through August, adjusted for any temporary identifiable deratings.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 4.2.3 &#150; Oil and Gas Steam Capacity (Cog)</font></u><font size=2>:  The Full Load rating of each oil and gas steam electric generating unit shall be based on the unit's demonstrated capability during hours when such unit demonstrates full output during the months of June through August, adjusted for any temporary identifiable deratings.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 4.2.4 &#150; Combined Cycle Capacity (Ccc)</font></u><font size=2>:  The Full Load rating of combined cycle generating units shall be based on the unit's demonstrated capability during hours when such unit demonstrates full output during the months of June through August, adjusted for any temporary identifiable deratings.  During the other months, an adjustment will be made to the Full Load rating to reflect the unit's capability at expected ambient temperatures for such non-summer period. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 4.2.5 &#150; Combustion Turbine Capacity (Cct)</font></u><font size=2>:  The Full Load rating of combustion turbine units is based on the demonstrated output of such unit and the manufacturer's base design curve rating.  Combustion turbine units shall demonstrate daily sustained capability during the </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="643" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="501" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Issued by:  Charles D. Long, IV, V.P., Fleet Operations &amp; Trading</font></p> </td>
        <td width="141" valign=top >

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Issued on:  May 18, 2007</font></p>

<H5 align="left" style="page-break-before:always">&nbsp;</H5><P>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="644" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="508" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Southern Company Services, Inc.</font></p> </td>
        <td width="136" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Original Sheet No. 32</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Second Revised Rate Schedule FERC Number 138</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><font size=2>months of June through August, adjusted for any temporary identifiable deratings.  During the fall, winter and spring, adjustments will be made to the Full Load rating to reflect the unit's capability at expected seasonal ambient temperatures.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 4.2.6 &#150; Peak Load Capacity (Cp)</font></u><font size=2>:  The Peak Load capacity of demonstrating generating units shall be the additional amount of generation obtained by operating all units at a given plant concurrently and under conditions such as, but not limited to, overpressure, valves wide open and top feedwater heaters out of service.  The Peak Load capacity shall be based on such unit's demonstrated capability during hours when the unit demonstrates peak load capability during the months of June through August, adjusted for temporary identifiable deratings.</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 4.2.7 &#150; Conventional (Ch) and Pumped Storage (Cpsh) Hydro Capacity</font></u><font size=2>:  For purposes of the IIC, hydro capability is the average simulated generation during eight (8) consecutive hours occurring on five (5) consecutive weekdays using the average water inflows from historical data.  The simulation process utilizes maximum (full) gate setting and best (most efficient) gate setting to determine the capability of the hydro facilities.  The capability for the months June-August is the summer maximum gate simulated rating.  For the months December-May, the capability is the winter maximum gate simulated rating.  The capability of the months September-November is the summer best gate simulated rating.  To the extent that an OPERATING COMPANY can demonstrate that a hydro facility can actually achieve the maximum gate rating during the fall
months, the capability of such hydro facility will be the maximum gate rating.  </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 4.2.8 &#150; Active Demand Side Options &#150; Equivalent Capacity (DSO)</font></u><font size=2>:  The equivalent capacity of each active demand side option for each month of the calendar year is determined from </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="643" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="501" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Issued by:  Charles D. Long, IV, V.P., Fleet Operations &amp; Trading</font></p> </td>
        <td width="141" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Effective: May 1, 2007</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Issued on:  May 18, 2007</font></p>

<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="644" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="508" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Southern Company Services, Inc.</font></p> </td>
        <td width="136" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Original Sheet No. 33</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>Second Revised Rate Schedule FERC Number 138</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><font size=2>the following formula:</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="76%" style='margin-left:108.9pt;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="66" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:162%'><font SIZE=2>DSO</font></p> </td>
        <td width="48" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:162%'><font size=2>=</font></p> </td>
        <td width="372" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:162%'><font size=2>[(Cv x ICE) / (1 -(%TL/100))] x A</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="66" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:162%'><font size=2>Where:</font></p> </td>
        <td width="48" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:162%'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="372" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:162%'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="66" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font SIZE=2>DSO</font></p> </td>
        <td width="48" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font size=2>=</font></p> </td>
        <td width="372" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font size=2>Demand side option equivalent capacity.</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="66" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>

    <tr >
        <td width="66" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font SIZE=2>ICE</font></p> </td>
        <td width="48" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font size=2>=</font></p> </td>

            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font size=2>Incremental capacity equivalent factor.</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="66" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>

        <td width="48" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>=</font></p> </td>
        <td width="372" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Six (6) percent incremental transmission losses.</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="66" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="48" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="372" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="66" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font SIZE=2>A</font></p> </td>
        <td width="48" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font size=2>=</font></p> </td>
        <td width="372" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:216%'><font size=2>Availability Factor.</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><font size=2>The Incremental Capacity Equivalent Factor is a measure of the effect of a demand side option on generating system reliability.  The Availability Factor is a measure of the probability of an active demand side option being available at the time it is needed. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 4.2.9 &#150; Reserved Contract Purchases and Sales (RPS)</font></u><font size=2>:  Reserved contract purchases and sales for any month include all contracted capacity purchases from and sales to OTHERS for which there are underlying reserves. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; text-indent:0.5in;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 4.2.10 &#150; Purchased Resource Capacity (PRC)</font></u><font size=2>:  Purchased resource capacity includes all purchased capacity for which an underlying generating resource is identified and may represent any type of capacity (</font><u><font size=2>e.g.</font></u><font size=2>, combined cycle). </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 4.3 &#150; Determination of Peak Hour Load Responsibility of Each OPERATING COMPANY (L)</font></u><font size=2>:  The monthly peak hour load responsibility of each OPERATING COMPANY is determined by the following formula:</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="76%" style='margin-left:108.9pt;border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="86" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:162%'><font SIZE=2>L </font></p> </td>
        <td width="34" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:162%'><font size=2>=</font></p> </td>
        <td width="366" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:3.0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:162%'><font size=2>L' x La/100</font></p> </td> </tr>
    <tr >
        <td width="86" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:162%'><font size=2>Where:</font></p> </td>
        <td width="34" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:justify;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:162%'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td>
        <td width="366" valign=top style='padding:0in 5.4pt 0in 5.4pt'>
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;line-height:162%'><font size=1>&nbsp;</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

    <tr >

            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Monthly average percent contribution of each OPERATING COMPANY&#146;s ten (10) highest hour average loads to the sum of those loads for all OPERATING COMPANIES for the most recent three-year period.</font></p> </td> </tr></table>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:1in; text-indent:-1in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 4.4 &#150; Recognition of Resource Additions or Deletions</font></u><font size=2>:  For additions or deletions of capacity resources for the coming year, an adjustment will be made in the capability resources of the appropriate OPERATING COMPANY based upon the actual date of the addition or deletion (</font><u><font size=2>e.g.</font></u><font size=2>, commercial operation, retirement, purchase, or sale); provided, however, that the adjustment will not be made in a month earlier than that originally established by the Operating Committee pursuant to the coordinated planning process.  If the actual date is on or before the 15th day of the month, the capacity adjustment begins in that month.  If the actual date is beyond the 15th day of the month, the capacity adjustment begins in the following month. </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt; margin-left:0.25in;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;line-height:200%;'><u><font size=2>Section 4.5 &#150; Capacity Outside of the Coordinated Planning Process</font></u><font size=2>:  If an OPERATING COMPANY has capacity that was not established by the Operating Committee as part of the coordinated planning process, such capacity will not be included as capacity available to the OPERATING COMPANY (pursuant to Section 4.2 of this Manual) for reserve sharing purposes (&#147;unrecognized capacity&#148;).  Notwithstanding the foregoing, if an OPERATING COMPANY&#146;s monthly capacity/load ratio, as determined by comparing its available capacity (pursuant to Section 4.2 of this Manual) with its load responsibility (pursuant to Section 4.3 of this Manual), is less than </font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:justify;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>

<p style=' margin-bottom:0pt; margin-top:0pt;text-align:left;'><font size=2>&nbsp;</font></p>


<table border="0" cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 width="643" style='border-collapse:collapse'>
    <tr >
        <td width="501" valign=top >
            <p style='margin-left:0pt;text-indent:0pt;text-align:left;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt'><font size=2>Issued by:  Charles D. Long, IV, V.P., Fleet Operations &amp; Trading</font></p> </td>
